headline: No-Rise Pizza Dough
description: This pizza dough recipe is a quick-and-easy, no-rise dough made with basic ingredients patted into a pan, topped as desired, and baked in 20 minutes.

video.description: See how to make pizza dough from scratch.
video.name: Pizza Dough I

name: No-Rise Pizza Dough
recipeIngredient: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour, sugar, yeast, and salt in a large bowl. Mix in warm water and oil until dough comes together.

review.reviewBody: Good recipe when there‚Äôs not time for letting it rise. I used bread flour and it was delicious and crunchy.

excellent quick - spur of the moment pizza crust!!! Makes a nice crisp crust very quickly. Thank you! (note, this is not a deep dish, risen dough, that takes a little more time, and planning ahead. We use Jay's recipe for that. This is for those times when you want pizza in 30 minutes - excellent!!!!)

This recipe is perfect. Quick , easy and the taste is perfect! Exactly what I was looking for! Thank you!! By the way‚Ä¶ Allrecipes really needs a dislike button for reviews. Some of these are ridiculous. ‚ÄúI only used half of the dough and put it on a large sheet and it hard.‚Äù ‚Äú This (quick no rise) recipe needs work. First you should let it rise. Second, I like more salt and garlic in mine, so I‚Äôm gonna take away a star for that too. Oh, and I like honey too. (Deducts an star) And now that it is no longer a quick dough you can throw together on a busy night, it needs to be rolled after you make it exactly to my preferences so no star for that either. Bake it exactly as written if you‚Äôre going to add a review. Or add what you like because you are, in theory, a capable grown adult. However, you sound ridiculous when you leave a review saying it was terrible after you‚Äôve changed everything or missed the entire point of a recipe.
I love this recipe. I put all the ingredients into my bread machine and put it on the dough setting then when done I press it onto a pizza pan and we have dinner. Great fast recipe.

I double the recipe to make 3 pizzas. Make it in the afternoon, then rests until dinner. Olive oil instead of vegetable, always king Arthur flour. Bake on a pizza stone preheated at 500 bake for 7 minutes. Love it!

HOW ON GOD'S GREEN EARTH DOES THIS RECIPE HAVE A 4.5 RATING!!!!!!! üò≥üò≥üò≥üò≥üò†üò†üò† First of all, I only used half the dough for a large cookie sheet and this recipe is TERRIBLE! The crust on the bottom is hard and chewy and No I did not overcook or burn it. I will NEVER use this recipe again and it boggles my mind that over 800 people gave this a 5 star rating. What the heck! ü§Ø And the ONLY reason I gave it a one star is because I HAVE to in order to leave a comment.
Very simple and perfect when in a hurry. I find letting the dough rest for a few minutes before use makes it more pliable.
Easy and turned out perfect

Hi Guys, hope you are well. I would like to try this recipe, I am however deciding whether I want to proof the yeast or not. Do advise - do I add more yeast if I double or triple the recipe. Be blessed!
really like this recipe. fast, easy and tastes great.
i made it in my bread maker, just on dough setting, it turned out wonderful

Easy recipe. Made it with my stand mixer, added maybe a 1/4 cup of water to the recipe, and of the optional herbs I added Mexican oregano. I baked it in a cast iron at 450F. I think the finished dough needed a bit more salt
Your ‚Äúgo to‚Äù recipe for homemade pizza
Yummy... Simple but nice flavor and very filling. Crust could use improvement but that was on me just as much or more than the actual recipe

Kid approved, quick and easy too!
I did add a bit more water as it seemed a bit dry, but it work out perfectly.

This is a great time saver recipe. I bump the flour up to 4 cups and the water up to 1 3/4 cups. And use 1.5 tsp to 2 tsp salt and 2 Tbsp sugar! Extra salt and sugar make this a top shelf dough. Same goes with sauce BTW. 

Toss 1 tsp or more thyme in either or both to make thyme appropriate (most) pizzas waaay better. Think about garlic butter and cheese croutons inside a rolled crust, too :). Ok I'm done suggesting ways to get to carb heaven haha.
Love how simple and fast it is! Always a crowd pleaser.

This recipe is very tasty- but I have used it for focaccia bread with a slight variation. I got the recipe from ‚Äúcrazy for rust‚Äù site and it is the recipe for focaccia
The only difference I think is that the dough has to rise and the use of instant yeast. Check it out if you like a light dough.

The family was happy with this pizza dough. It was nice not to have to make the dough earlier in the day. We added 1 tsp Italian Seasoning to the dough, something we tried with another recipe and liked. The only thing we will do different next time is to pre-bake the crust for a bit before we add our toppings. Otherwise, we will definitely use this recipe again.
1st time making pizza! Came out pretty good. Made a double batch, 2 pizzas. Used garlic butter on crust before we topped. Yummm

Dissolved yeast with water and olive oil. Added "Italian spice mix"to the dry ingredients. Bacon fat to grease the pan for flavour and a crispy, golden bottom. Poked holes with fork into the dough to prevent bubbles. I did two bakes. The first was for 12 minutes at 400¬∞ F. Brushed bacon fat on top of partly baked "dough", to prevent the sauce, toppings from making the crust soggy. Brushed bacon fat on top edges for a nice brown colour for the crust "handles". Laid toppings. Baked a further 25 minutes. Cooled on a rack. Can you tell we like a thin, crispy crust? ??
Did a deep dish in a cast iron frying pan and it was amazing! great recipe.
My family NEVER likes homemade pizza but I thought I'd try this one. My husband thought it was so good, he asked me to make it again.

Thank you so much, I was looking for a pizza dough that I didn't have to wait for hours for the dough to rise. This was very easy to prepare. I made the recipe exactly as written. The only change I made was I bake it in a 9x13 pan. Terrific.
Very easy, fun and tastes great. We all love to make our own pizzas.
RENAKS27 I followed your recipe... turned out amazing..thank you!!
I have made 7 batches to date. Wonderful for both thin and medium crust pizza‚Äôs. We even made a great breakfast pizza with this dough. Supper fast and tasty. Thanks!
Great the way it is.
Very easy and the crust was soft and tasty. I only have a small electric over so I divided the dough into 3 sections and pressed them into 8 inch round cake pans. Perfectly cooked in 25 minutes.
Waaay too thick. I will adjust the recipe next time.

So delicious and super fast! Also a really good foundation for other breads! I did reduce the yeast a bit. Since I didn't have a kitchen scale, the first time I made it I used 1.5 tsp (my attempt at estimating the mg the recipe called for) of yeast but the second time reduced to just 1 tsp and that was perfect!

Making this recipe I didn‚Äôt have enough bread flour left so I had to also use ap flour and I reduced the serving size. Had to add more flour to get the stiff consistency required. Overall, this is a good recipe and will use again!

I love making from scratch, and am gluten free (celiac). So when I can make something good and home made, it's great. This recipes liquid to dry ratio is far from equal and dough is a bit dry to work with, but comes out delicious. This is my second time making it and I love that I don't need help from hubby. Recommend this recipe completely. Enjoy!!
This crust is very good as is. It is quick and easy. No changes are necessary.
I made as is and it was not good at all!
Such an easy recipe and it tastes so good. We are trying it in a cast iron skillet for a deep dish pizza with fresh basil and ricotta. I used the extra to make bread sticks.
Very easy and tasty. Was a big hit with the family and I have used this recipe countless times.
It was as hard as rock when I took it out of the oven
This pizza dough recipe is amazing. It is so easy to make and very quick. We have made it several times. I add an Italian butter wash over the dough before topping, but it is great without it too!
The crust just plain wasn't good at all. We ate the topping off the crust. I followed the recipe exact. Don't waste your time or ingredients!
love it x 1000000 the best
Make this recipe just as it's written! It's delicious, light and crispy, and it's fast! No need to wait for rising dough, which is good for me since I often forget to start the dough early.
Everybody loved it!!!! Easy to make!

It was very easy and the pizza crust turned out delicious. I pressed out the dough onto a pizza sheet. I then let it sit for a bit with a wet dish towel on top so it did rise a bit. I placed on the grill first with just a brushing of EVOO for about 3-4 minutes. Removed it and put my topping, placed back on the grill for an additional 4-5 minutes. Dough had a crispy crust with a doughy top. Perfect and delish!
Easy and delicious

This pizza dough recipe is perfect! However, I don‚Äôt follow the instructions provided. I prefer to proof the yeast and let the dough rise overnight in the fridge. I divide the dough into three for a nice, thin crust. Also, if you want to add move flavours, add it to your base sauce, no need to change the dough ingredients!

Another note regarding the video: you have to knead the dough properly, don‚Äôt expect perfect texture from just whipping it in a bowl!

I use this recipe every time we have homemade pizza. If you 1 and 1/2 times the recipe (except still only one package of yeast), I can make two decent sized pizzas, feed my family of 6, and have a couple slices for leftovers.
Favorite kid loving recipe
quick and easy amazing!
Quick easy simple. I like to leave it in the pan to raise a little before putting in the oven. Makes perfect pizzas every time.
So quick and easy! Brushed the dough with Italian herb infused olive oil, brushed it on the dough, Added toppings and had delicious pizza
No changes. Turned out very good.

My family loves this classic recipe. Also those who are arguing in the reviews, chill out. Its good pizza dough no matter how you make it. Add what ever you want to it. Cook how you want not how other people tell you to.
Fast, easy and delicious
Changed nothing and it was fabulous! Great for last minute.

Great recipe. I have made it several times. I have time and prefer to do a rise. This is definitely not necessary of you like a crispier crust, The only thing I do different is 1 teaspoon of salt. That is just because I like the taste.

I have made this a few times over the years and i decided to leave a review as ive made it again tonight.
Its perfect! Everyone including the kids loved the pizza dough 5 Stars
Thus was an easy to make recipe that turned out well. I let it rise a bit before cooking and it was a hit..
For a quick fix, this one hits the spot.

This is a great no wait pizza crust recipe. Before I found this recipe, it seemed too much of a bother to make pizza unless it was planned in advance. I followed the recipe as is and get pizza in under an hour instead a few hours. To do a thin crust pizza, I split the dough in half for a 13‚Äù pan.
I used bread flour for some reason, did make crust a little more chewy, but good flavor and a tremendous improvement over the store bought frozen dough sold at the deli. Easier to stretch.
I made this crust, because it was fast. I'll go for a different one next time. I was flat and tasteless!
I've made this twice. This is definitely quick and easy. Though dough tastes good. This is now apart of the family! Thank you!
So simple! So excited to taste it when it comes out of the oven.

Actually for being so simple I was surprised how it turned out. I rolled it out a bit with a rolling pin but used hands as well to stretch in into a 12" pizza pan. Nice and crunchy with good body. I used spelt flour but I think next time I'll mix half spelt and half wheat for better flavor.
I followed recipe as is. I added herbs with seasonings to enhance flavor to the pizza and the breadsticks. I also made my own pizza sauce which made it even better. But overall crust recipe is good.
So fast and easy! I love being able to make this even after work and still have a home made pizza! Way better than calling out for pizza!
Super easy and while family loved it!
didn't know how to rate it, it may be fine but mine just didn't turn out, it was very ......dry or hard I could barley roll it out.

Really good and easy. I‚Äôve made this twice and I increased (1 1/2 size batch) the second time so I could fill a jelly roll pan sized pizza. I didn‚Äôt need to. I rolled it out and it looked very thin but it raised thicker when it cooked and had a tough time getting done. Do, roll it thin and recommend making two separate pizzas if you need more pizza rather than trying a jelly roll pan! We heated the stove top center grill and browned the bottom of the middle pieces, they browned nicely! A good and easy recipe. Thanks!
This is not a gourmet crust. But it is a super fast, yummy yeast crust, so for me, it is 5 stars.
This was, by far, the best pizza dough recipe I have tried. I will definitely be using it again.

I followed the previous reviewer's instructions and activated the yeast for 10 minutes (until foamy). I also let the dough rise for ~10 minutes. Added garlic powder (LOTS!!) and oregano. My family loved it, will definitely make again!
Did not like the taste or texture sorry

The dough was easy to put together. Simple ingredients and cook time was a breeze. 
If you like thin crust crispy pizza this is for you. 
I usually like my dough to rise but in a hurry this recipe is aces. 
Topped it with mozzarella and pepperoni.

I made this with olive oil in place of vegetable, and I proofed the yeast first- added it to the sugar and water and let stand for 10 minutes to make sure my yeast was active. I added 1 tsp garlic powder and 1 tsp oregano to the flour and salt, and I used a mixer with a dough hook to pull it together in the mixing bowl and I kneaded it for about 5 minutes on low. The dough was sticky & I oiled the bowl and let it rise in a warm place for about 30
Very easy recipe! The only problem I had with it was getting it out of the bowl onto the pan. It was a bit sticky but that was probably my fault. A little extra flour fixed that.

The pizza turned out great! The dough was fast and easy. It tasted good and rolled out to a nice size. I could've gone even bigger for a thin crust. Kept it on the 3/4" (after baking) and it was tasty. I followed the directions and threw it all in my it in my Kitchenaid. Walked away for 5 minutes with it on setting 2. Tada! Dough ready to roll.
My family loves this easy pizza dough. The taste is great and it's easy to make WITHOUT waiting for it to rise. We can now make pizza on weeknights in under an hour start to finish!
Great dough, used for school project! Don‚Äôt level sugar or salt, and use Italian herbs and spices and garlic butter on top
I made a Spinache flower pie for my wife and coworkers with this dough. It was very easy to work with.

Super easy to prepare!!! Using a stand mixer, all the dry ingredients, then the oil and water. I used olive oil. Let the mixer run another 5 mins to knead. That's it !! Presto speedo !! Makes awesome Calzones too !!

Made it as described. Very happy with it. So easy and the family loved it. Just covered it with spaghetti sauce and topped with mozzarella and put in the oven. I am sure a more complex pizza crust is much better. This is more dense. But when the kids are crying for food, there's no time for pizza crust to rise. With the kitchen-aid mixer, this couldn't be easier, so I will definitely make it again.
Except for the addition of sugar, this is essentially the food processor pizza dough recipe from Fleischmann's Yeast. It's easy and that's exactly what I needed. Thanks for sharing!
I only used 1.5 teaspoon yeast
The crust was beautiful, but tasted like a biscuit to me. I didn‚Äôt like this flavor.
Very successful. Easy. Enjoyed the pizza made with the dough
It was very good without any modifications
We liked this. Didn't let dough rise. It would have been good with Italian seasoning in it.
There is a difference between traditional active dry yeast and instant active dry yeast. Traditional dry active yeast did not work for me.

I let the dough rest for 30 mins after it comes together. Then I gently knead it adding flour to my hands and surface ( I use an old cotton pillow case.) until it is smooth and elastic. Half is put into a Pam sprayed container and frozen. The only changes were to increase water temp to 115 to 120 degrees and add 1 TBLSP extra water. This will leave less flour in the bowl. The temp increase is ok because you are adding the yeast to the flour mixture not the water. Thanks a lot for the recipe. We now have pizza every Friday night. No allergy worries with home made pizza!

I liked the simpleness of this recipe but I did tweek it a bit.
I added the oil,yeast,warm water, and sugar and let it activate for five minutes. Then added it to the flour plus a little extra so it's not as stick. Then let it rise in a warm place for 30mins. After that I split it into even pieces and put in the freezer

I made this pizza dough and it turned out so perfect was cheese pizza was a HIT with the kids they even said it was better than the restaurant the yeast I used was fast active pizza dough I used canola oil instead of vegetable the cheese I used was both Italian and Mozzarella Marinara sauce I put it in a cast iron skillet and brushed an Italian season oil on it and Viol√† pizza in 45 minutes

I have been using this recipe for several years now. From pizza to flat bread. A very versatile recipe. I have added different seasonings for my flat bread. when making wraps. The possibilities are only limited to one's imagination. Thanh you for the wonderful recipe.

I think this recipe was great. I was really craving breadsticks so I decided to whip some up, the problem was I only had an hour. I made this recipe and it satisfied all my breadstick cravings. At first it seemed dense and chewy but when cooked it came out airy and delicious. I did have to add about 1/2 more flour then the recipe said.
Mehhh. The crust turned out awful. It‚Äôs better to wait another 40minutes to have the dough rest and rise.
Simple and blank slate recipe. You could add some oregano and garlic to add flavor or keep as is - it's a great recipe for cooking at home.
It is what it says it is. Simple I cover it in a bowl for an hour so it can rise a bit and then put on pan and make my pizza. Love it!!
Perfect everytime !
